Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance, and scalability. Identify the applications and workloads that will use Azure Managed Lustre.
Design the storage architecture, including the placement of Lustre file systems, integration with existing Azure resources, and access patterns.
Create and configure the Azure Managed Lustre file system in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Specify the required storage capacity and performance tier.
Set up virtual network configurations to ensure secure access to the Lustre file system. Configure subnets, Network Security Groups (NSGs), and private endpoints as needed.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure access control policies and integrate with Azure Active Directory for authentication.
Perform thorough testing of the Lustre file system, including I/O performance, scalability, and failover scenarios to ensure it meets the required specifications.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools. Configure alerts for file system health, performance metrics, and capacity thresholds.
Document the storage architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide guidelines for users on accessing and utilizing the Lustre file system.
Ensure the setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Establish a support process for managing the Lustre file system, including handling incidents, scaling storage, and optimizing performance.

Continuously monitor the performance metrics of Azure Managed Lustre storage, including IOPS, throughput, and latency. Use Azure Monitor and other tools to identify and address performance bottlenecks.
Regularly review storage capacity utilization to ensure sufficient space is available for workloads. Plan for scaling or optimization as needed.
Perform regular checks to ensure backups of Azure Managed Lustre data are complete, consistent, and restorable. Test restoration processes periodically.
Review and update security policies for Azure Managed Lustre storage, including access controls and encryption settings, to align with organizational and regulatory requirements.
Conduct regular audits of Azure Managed Lustre configurations to ensure compliance with best practices and organizational standards.
Test failover mechanisms to ensure high availability and disaster recovery capabilities of Azure Managed Lustre storage.
Analyze storage performance data and implement optimizations to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
Simulate storage-related incidents to test the team's readiness and response protocols. Update procedures based on lessons learned.
Evaluate the performance of Azure Managed Lustre against the service-level agreement (SLA). Address any deviations or issues.
Develop and execute plans for upgrading or expanding Azure Managed Lustre storage as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Azure Managed Lustre features, best practices, and security measures.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure Managed Lustre performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
